attributes.action: Give excess Army rations to homeless
attributes.background: During the whole of the 2015/16 financial year 10,798 Army ORP (Operational Ration Packs) were disposed of, and 5,004 in the year before that.

attributes.action: Parental responsibility should be transferred to the parent who has residency.
attributes.background: Currently the law indicates that Parental Responsibility is those who have legal rights and responsibilities for the child's upbringing, who can make decisions regarding schooling, name changes etc. I want the government to debate if the law should be amended in the cases where a parent wants no
attributes.additional_details: further contact with a child and cases of harm to the child, for the responsibility and decision making to be transferred over to the remaining parent. My sons father is unable to see his son due to the CAFCASS report and he also informed court he wants no further contact. I have changed my sons surname by Deedpoll but passport etc needs authorisation and permission from the father, even in these circumstances when all evidence shown. These rights should be abolished.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory education for children on how to save & the cost of living.
attributes.background:
There is currently nothing compulsory in the curriculum to teach children about debts, managing your money or the cost of living.

Personal and social education should include modules to help prevent a future society in debt. 

#TeachOurKidsToSave
attributes.additional_details:
Children are encouraged to get student loans and surrounded by advertising encouraging them to get into debt. With education in high school this could be avoided.
Also 

Student loans, is 18 old enough to decide to get into debt? 

With rents rising, students are finishing university with more debt than ever. If you had known the impact of having this debt could of stopped your mortgage affordability. Would you still have had yours if you had been taught early on to save?

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for NHS staff.
attributes.background: Many  companies provide discounts for their staff. Hardworking NHS staff also deserve a discounts.

attributes.action: Increase fines and ban cyclists from the road who jump red lights.
attributes.background:
It seems to becoming more apparent that cyclists in London and more recently Manchester are failing to stop at red lights, risking serious injuries to pedestrians.

The problem has also been increased by delivery companies using cyclists to deliver goods and failing to stop at red lights.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Institute of Advanced Motorists, 57% of cyclists admit to running red lights. A 2013 YouGov poll found that 35% of cyclists admit to ignoring red lights at least “occasionally.”

If caught jumping a red light, cyclists can be issued a Fixed Penalty Notice of £30.

The Law is unfair. A motorist jumping a light,  will lead to a Fixed Penalty Notice of 3 points and £100 fine.

The same Law should  apply to cyclists who should also carry third party insurance as a minimum.

attributes.action: Invest in more Gender Clinics around the UK
attributes.background: There are currently two Gender Clinics in the UK - one in London and one in Leeds. The waiting list for both clinics can be up to 18 months, sometimes even longer, because of the increase in acceptance and openness about gender identity.
attributes.additional_details: I was referred to Tavistock in London in April/May 2016 and my referral got accepted around November 2016, I am still currently waiting for an appointment 9/10 months on from my referral date. From personal experience, the NHS are an incredible asset to the UK and without it we'd undeniably be in a much worse position. However, Gender Clinics are very far stretched and I struggle with the wait hugely which has major impacts on my mental health. I'm not the only one with this issue, fact.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that schools, colleges & staff working with children know CPR
attributes.background:
After reading so many stories this week, both positive and negative, people are still dying because of the lack of basic first aid training

Hopefully this will go to the government and ask why schools, colleges and people that work with children aren't being taught CPR & the importance of it.
attributes.additional_details:
Making this compulsory, will not only save someone's life if the need arises, but will make people aware of the need for training. 

Being an aspiring Paramedic, I know the importance of bystander CPR, as it increases the percentage of someone being saved and regaining life.

attributes.action: Right to buy from housing association with full discount make housing accessible
attributes.background:
We have Right to buy which provides you discount if you have lived in council property for over 3 years. 

We can get up to 50% discount of property 

Like if you lived in council property for 15 years you are eligible for 45% Discount 

£150000 * 45 / 100 = 67,500 you pay only £82,500
attributes.additional_details:
https://righttobuy.gov.uk/right-to-buy-calculator/

https://www.gov.uk/right-to-acquire-buying-housing-association-home/overview

We would like the government to provide the same discount for Right to Acquire as Right to Buy. This will help lot of people to get on property ladder and easily accessible especially for younger generation as they are eligible if they have lived in the household. With rise in rent and housing prices this would be best option for lower to middle class to become owners

attributes.action: To allow free parking for up to three hours on all NHS hospital car parks.
attributes.background: The NHS state that they are making no profit from car parking charges, this cannot be correct when a Press Association report states that the NHS raised £120,000,000 (120 Million pounds sterling) from charges last year, up 5%.

attributes.action: Men to be given automatic parental responsibility like women when a baby is due.
attributes.background: Woman have fought hard for their equal rights and they got it, which is just right, but when it comes to pregnancy men do not have the same rights as women and I aim to change that. I am a father to be and I have discovered that a father has to be registered on the birth certificate to have the....
attributes.additional_details: same rights as the mother to their new born child unless courts say otherwise. I want you to ask yourself something, what happens when both parents break up and the mother has a severe dislike to the father? lots of people act out of anger. The father has to pay thousands of pounds just to see his child a few days a week when he probably doesn't deserve that kinda treatment. people judge today by the actions of stupid men in the past but if we are all equal then why is the father the outcast?

attributes.action: hold referendum on ending public financing of the royal family.
attributes.background: redecorating Buckingham palace will cost the taxpayer 367 million pounds, why isn't this very wealthy family responsible for the maintenance of the properties they live in? A referendum should be held for us to decide if they should continue to receive any finance from British taxpayers.

attributes.action: Protect Whistleblowers in care sectors who are dismissed after whistle blowing
attributes.background: How many people working in any care sector have had to blow the whistle to find shortly after the procedure,they lose their job?I ask to protect whistleblowers after whistleblowing procedure.Future disciplinary hearings(or the like)to be held by different members of staff than the original procedure
attributes.additional_details: Whistleblowers need more protection than they get currently in the care sector. Too many people who choose to stand for the right thing and fight, lose their jobs in the end-these righteous people are the people we need working as doctors, nurses, support workers etc. There must be a change.

attributes.action: Do not use educational establishments as polling stations for general election
attributes.background: The government's call for a snap general election on June 8th 2017 will require a significant number of schools to close to students for the day with additional associated disruption to many parents who may need to take annual leave in order to look after children unable to attend school.
attributes.additional_details: It has been recently agreed in Supreme Court that disruption to the education of our children by removing them from school for even half a day is unacceptable (ref:Isle of Wight Council v Platt) yet the standard practice of using educational establishments as polling stations will cause unnecessary chaos to millions of students and parents / guardians at short notice if the snap general election goes ahead on June 8th 2017.

attributes.action: Repeal the handgun ban of 1996/97
attributes.background: The handgun ban had no effect on crime and did nothing but punish legitimate handgun shooters
attributes.additional_details: http://theconversation.com/dunblane-massacre-20-years-on-how-britain-rewrote-its-gun-laws-and-the-challenge-it-faces-now-55896

attributes.action: Introduce job requirements for government cabinet roles.
attributes.background:
Cabinet positions in the government should be based on meeting strict job criteria as in industry. 

For example, Michael Gove was both the Secretary of State for Education and Justice, yet the different roles require specific knowledge and expertise that is not immediately transferable.
attributes.additional_details:
Applying to a senior position in any role requires a senior level of expertise relating to that role.

If the public are subject to such strict requirements then certainly our ministers should be too. This would ensure that the policy makers have a credible knowledge and experience to make the right policies for the country, not policies that align solely with their ideology.

attributes.action: Introduce plain packaging with health warnings on unhealthy fast food
attributes.background: Obesity is a major health problem in modern society and rivals the problems caused by smoking tobacco products, and should be treated like it by introducing plain packaging just like cigarettes.
attributes.additional_details:
Obesity causes many different and complex health implications including, but not limited to; cancer, cardiovascular disease and type 2 diabetes. By 2050, obesity is estimated to affect 60% of adult men and 50% of adult women in addition to 25% of children. The resulting NHS cost is projected to reach (by 2050) £9.7 billion and further costs to society are estimated to be £49.9 billion per year.
Reference - http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity

attributes.action: Decrease class numbers of children in public primary and secondary schools.
attributes.background: Classes of 30 are far too crowded. There is increased potential for unsettled distruption from behaviour, louder noise, lack of physical space & lack of 1:1 teaching support. This challenges a child's capacity to learn, engage, be understood, understand and hear and see what is being taught clearly.
attributes.additional_details:
Teachers cannot give individual attention where a ratio is 1 to 30. This may impede a child being able to reach thier potential. Gifted children may go unnoticed, those with special needs may act out distress through challenging behaviour, others may struggle to engage, drop out of school, or become excluded. Feelings of unsafety due to overstimulation and not enough individual attention may also arise.

Research:- https://www.classsizematters.org
The above research was carried out in America.

attributes.action: Give the UK a 2nd EU Referendum or call a General Election
attributes.background: The majority vote from the EU referendum in June 2016 was 4% (51.8 Leave vs. 48.1 Remain). This margin is too small for the Government to take the United Kingdom out of the EU. Since June the people of the UK now know more about the terms of Brexit so we should have a 2nd vote.
attributes.additional_details:
The case for leaving the EU is too big for any of us to comprehend fully. It is economical and cultural. We can not allow the matter of British 'principle' and 'sticking to our guns' to allow the Government to dogmatically pursue the goal to take the United Kingdom out of the European Union. 

Offering the British people a second vote isn't 'going back' on David Cameron's assertion that this is a 'once in a lifetime vote', it is quite simply the right thing to do. The stakes are simply too high.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a service provider to have a premium rate phone number.
attributes.background: Make it illegal for service providers to have a premium rate phone number so contacting them regarding their services is of great personal cost. This should cover, delivery companies, all house hold bills and any shops that you need to contact for any reason relating to a goods or service bought.

attributes.action: End hospital parking charges for NHS staff.
attributes.background:
NHS staff are overworked and underpaid. It is unfair that despite all of this they have to pay to park their car at work each day.

The department for health should abolish parking charges for their loyal NHS staff who are already stretched to the limit.
attributes.additional_details: Staff frequently work through their unpaid breaks and voluntarily work over their hours, only to see parking fees deducted from their already low salary each month. In a workforce that is already stretched to the absolute limit and who have received minimal pay increases in recent years, surely free parking isn't too much to ask.

attributes.action: Stop Article 50 until the Parliamentary DCMS inquiry into fake news is finished
attributes.background: Over the years a lot of fake news has been about the EU that has been repeated so often that people now think its TRUE. The DCMS inquiry into the impact of fake news on the democratic process may show that the result of the EU Referendum is unsound due to the undue influence of this deceptive news.
attributes.additional_details: Fake News is not new. In the late 1980s and early 1990s Boris Johnson reported on the European Commission. At the time: "Many of his fellow journalists ... were critical of his articles, opining that they often contained untruths designed to discredit the Commission, with The Guardian's John Palmer stating that "as a journalist he is thoroughly irresponsible, making up stories." " From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson#The_Times_and_The_Daily_Telegraph:_1987.E2.80.9394 (17-02-2017)

attributes.action: Retain local anaesthesia, prior to donation, for those blood donors who need it.
attributes.background:
Donating blood is, generally, pain-free but for some it can be very painful.  Anaesthesia is available for those donors who need it but
from April 2017 it will no longer be available.  

In my own case, I was advised never to give blood without anaesthetic after an incident at a donor session.
attributes.additional_details:
Blood & Transplant make the point that their Donor Carers have excellent needle skills and that B&T have developed various distraction and coping techniques to enable donors to donate without anaesthesia.
For those who simply have a fear of needles, this is an excellent step forward.  For those whose anatomy makes donation a complicated, prolonged and painful experience such techniques will be of little use.
The withdrawal of Lidocaine will only save the NHS about £30,000 per year

attributes.action: Enforce legislation to ensure out of date food is donated or recycled/reused.
attributes.background: Supermarkets, restaurants, farmers, corner shops and all establishments of similar nature have a certain percentage of food waste. This is unacceptable, when it has a potential.
attributes.additional_details:
This food waste is not always used to its full potential and can end up in landfill especially if it's still in its packaging.

This food surplus can be used more wisely, whether it's used to help the less fortunate or even burned as biofuel.

attributes.action: Return Common Sense to Court, Abolish the PC interfering 'Sentencing Council'
attributes.background: English courts no longer have TEETH! Due to its overly lenient & PC guidelines & interference, The 'Sentencing Council' has seriously undermined public confidence in our Courts.Tying the hands of judges by having them put Political Correctness before common sense & appropriate punishment
attributes.additional_details:
Forcing courts to follow these guidelines is preventing judges from handing down the prescribed penalties, fines & or custodial sentences (described in various criminal legislations & acts) as they were originally intended by the acts of Parliament.

The Council exists to ensure consistency of sentencing, clarification of court processes and sentencing for the victims and the public, and to increase public confidence in the criminal justice system. It has failed completely to do this.

attributes.action: Ban all Spread Betting, CFD, and Binary Option provider's from the UK market
attributes.background: Spread Betting, CFD, and Binary Option provider's are manipulating the UK stock market to such an extent, that it creates very high levels of volatility within our top 250 UK listed companies.
attributes.additional_details: The resulting fallout from these providers has turned what was once an optional investment strategy for private investors, into a cesspool of manipulated criminality that now controls our stock market through what are known as 'STOP-OUT' clauses.

attributes.action: Stop the need for people with permanent disabilities to renew their Blue Badges
attributes.background: Currently everyone in need of a blue badge has to renew it every 3 years. In some cases where the situation is temporary this is fine. For most though their situations are not going to change. It is unnecessary for us to renew.

attributes.action: Examine the practicalities of introducing a ringfenced tax to help fund the NHS.
attributes.background:
The truth is that the UK is falling further behind other European countries in how much is spent on health. It is time to examine a dedicated ringfenced health and care tax.

The Treasury has estimated that a 1p rise in income tax would raise £3.9bn this year, rising to £4.5bn the year after.
attributes.additional_details:
Linking tax income with health and care spending would give people the opportunity to see how their money is being spent, and allow a legitimate debate about what is an appropriate level of taxation required to ensure a sustainable funding settlement for the NHS and social care system in the years to come. 

The Treasury has estimated that a 1p rise in income tax would raise £3.9bn this year, rising to £4.5bn next year and then £4.6bn in 2018-19. Without major reforms to how care is provided, the NHS in England is facing a £22bn gap in its finances by 2020-21.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid contribution from 0.7% to 0.2% GDP
attributes.background: In the current climate of government cuts to our Local authorities, NHS and social funding (specifically OAP) it is completely unacceptable to be sending approximately 12 billion pounds of UK tax payers money out of the country when our own services are failing.

attributes.action: Change Use Class C3 wording to prevent LTD Company abuse of “Lawful Development”
attributes.background: Planning regs. Use Class C3 wording should be changed to “up to six people living together as a single household and receiving care from non-residential carers” to stop multimillion £ Ltd Companies using private residential houses as care homes without requiring planning permission for change of use
attributes.additional_details:
Councils are consistently concluding that a change of use DOES occur.  

Some are rejecting applications and some are issuing certificates on the basis that the change does not constitute a MATERIAL change in use in PLANNING TERMS.

Application DA/2015/0762 in Daventry District Council and SL/2016/0608 South Lakeland District Council were both submitted by the same company with a multi-million £ turnover citing the same evidence.  One rejected, the other permitted. 

Two of many inconsistencies.

attributes.action: Make the Asylum seeker dispersal scheme mandatory to all councils in the U.K.
attributes.background:
The process in which Asylum seekers are granted housing in the U.K. is dependant on councils that volunteer to be part of the scheme. 
Currently, there is no mandatory requirement for all councils to participate meaning that councils are able to, and do abstain from the effort.
attributes.additional_details:
The humanitarian crisis we are facing should not be left only to those councils most willing, as it creates an unnecessarily large strain on some councils that should be shared. 

At least 38 councils have not signed up to the scheme which includes the rehoming of refugee children who entered the UK alone. 

The current voluntary system is unfair, and means that schools, healthcare resources and other public services in participating councils are needlessly overstretched.

attributes.action: Lower Business rates in England
attributes.background: Small businesses are struggling to survive crippling business rates. Rates must be reassessed and lowered so small businesses continue to provide income and work for people. Internet sales & Brexit have put small businesses seriously at risk, Theresa May wants business to increase in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Amount of shops closing and small businesses that just cannot pay present level of business rates.

attributes.action: Automatically grant all UK parents joint custody of their children upon birth
attributes.background: Update and define our parental responsibility 'laws' to reflect today's social climate. Currently, it is estimated that 40% of all children born in the UK arrive here via unmarried parents. Fathers must be granted equal rights and status to their children on a 50/50 basis, regardless of status

attributes.action: Support the setup of educational foster care homes - like free schools.
attributes.background:
I am a Primary School Teacher and a Foster (Kinship) Carer. For many years I have seen and taught children who are in care - Looked After Child (LAC). These children need us! 
An educational foster home could offer stability, consistency, care and love and deliver fantastic outcomes for children.
attributes.additional_details:
Nearly 64,000 children live with almost 55,000 foster families across the UK each day. This is nearly 80% of the 81,000 children in care away from home on any one day in the UK. 

The Government's DfE paper states: “Where birth parents cannot meet a child’s basic needs it is one of the state’s most important responsibilities to step in and ensure that children can have a childhood which keeps them safe and enables them to flourish." 

With a UK shortage of foster carers this petition can help!

attributes.action: Allow children access to more speech therapy on the NHS.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to offer more speech therapy on the NHS.  I have been fighting to get my son help for 2 years. We have to pay privately for someone to listen to us. We are seen weekly privately, but the NHS won't offer anywhere close to this. Our son has made so much progress having weekly sessions.

attributes.action: I propose we have a referendum to change the current immigration rules.
attributes.background:
I would like to prevent the following countries citizens from immigrating to the UK for security concerns.
Indonesia
Pakistan
Bangladesh
Nigeria
Iran
Turkey
Egypt
Algeria
Morocco
Iraq
Sudan
Saudi Arabia
Afghanistan
Ethiopia
Uzbekistan
Yemen
Niger
Somalia

attributes.action: Provide anonymity for those accused of sexual assault until they're found guilty
attributes.background: While we find complete sympathy with all men and women who have been raped, the anonymity provided to the accusers must be extended to the accused until a verdict is reached. Careers are easily destroyed on allegations alone - even when the accused is found innocent. The imbalance is unjustifiable.
attributes.additional_details: In many circumstances in the past careers and livelihoods have been ruined by such allegations - even when the accused were eventually found innocent in a court of law. For many of the same reasons that the accusers are granted anonymity, we should extend this to accused to allow them protection from public scrutiny until they are found guilty.

attributes.action: Make tattoo discrimination illegal
attributes.background: Tattoo discrimination, especially in the work place, should be made illegal, judge people by their talent, not by looks

attributes.action: Ban cropping/clipping of a dog's ears
attributes.background: Ban the cropping/clipping of a dogs ears, unless it's for medical reasons. Most commonly seen in pit breeds, cropping a puppies ears purely for cosmetic reasons is mutilation. It's cruel and serves no purpose for their health. Only for the owners enjoyment.

attributes.action: Allow our FIREFIGHTERS to use seized & impounded vehicles for training purposes.
attributes.background: FIREFIGHTERS have to purchase scrap vehicles in order to train in essential skills such as roof & door removal, car fires & people extraction so that WE can be saved in emergency situations. WHY are we crushing vehicles seized at the roadside when we could GIVE these to the FIRE FIGHTERS!? Help NOW!
attributes.additional_details: Firefighters have to buy scrap vehicles from their own budgets at times when front line services are being cut and cars, seized at the roadside by the Police are being crushed into cubes when they could be used in training. Purchased vehicles are used VERY sparingly in order to extend training as they cannot afford to buy them when seized cars are being cubed daily. These skills that require practice save lives - please sign this petition as it could be your life saved by your signature one day!

attributes.action: Youths 14-18 required to be CRB checked if working at a youth organisation
attributes.background: Children at youth organisations in the UK are being put at risk as there is no current guidelines or law allowing a youth worker/leader to check on the Sex offenders register about a person who is under 18.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to change to allow a youth who will be mixing with children to be checked against the register, as under 18 no CRB checks are ever made and this is dangerous.

attributes.action: Provide free accommodation for ex-service personnel
attributes.background: As Veterans have served our country and risked their lives, why should they be left out in the cold with no food or water. All Veterans should be given accommodation after leaving the Forces until they are able to support themselves again.

attributes.action: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 until 23rd June, 2031.
attributes.background: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union until 23rd June, 2031, that is a period of 15 years from the referendum date. This delay is to enable the economy to stabilise and allow proper preparations to be put in place for the separation from the European Union.

attributes.action: Make diagnosed medical need the same as disability for discrimination laws
attributes.background: As someone suffering from diagnosed coeliac disease, I am appalled that there is no legislation which protects our rights (and those with other medically diagnosed conditions) from discrimination, unless that diagnosis happens to be recognised as a disability in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst restaurants, cafes and other public bodies and places have to make reasonable adjustments for people with disability, there is no requirement for them to do likewise for a medically diagnosed condition, such as diabetes and coeliac disease.

Hospitals often fail to provide any gluten free menu options for coeliacs and despite NICE guidelines, the NHS trusts are withdrawing prescriptions for gluten free food, the only treatment for coeliacs (yet still prescribe food for other conditions).

attributes.action: Decommissioned Schools should be reused for community use
attributes.background: Schools that have been decommissioned are being sold to building firms and not reintroduced to their community to help support children, young people and the elderly. Some areas within communities have the lack of space to provide services that will benefit it's people
attributes.additional_details: It's down to the Secretary of State for education to ask local charities and other service providers the opportunity to take over the function of a decommissioned school and then as a last resort sell to the highest bidder. Schools that have served communities can continue to do so but in other ways, Kirkley ward in Lowestoft Suffolk has exactly this, a school that has been vacant for years, but hasn't been decommissioned by the Secretary of State, but can continue to support the community

attributes.action: Make it statutory for Police to have dogs in a property secured before entering
attributes.background: There are currently no Police protocols for dogs being secured before they enter a property. Dogs can not differentiate between a police officer or trespasser! Many dogs are destroyed for being labelled "dangerously out of control", when in fact, they felt threatened and are protecting their owner.
attributes.additional_details: Regardless of why police are at a property, making it a requirement for homeowners to be asked to secure dogs later to be retrieved by force dog section, will not only protect officers, but also the public if the dog(s) were to escape. Innocent dogs are destroyed due to police errors, Officers are trained to foresee hostile situations and in some cases things can escalate quickly and knowing that any dogs are safely secured will protect not only them but also the police and the public.

attributes.action: Pass Mandatory Laws for cycling in the UK
attributes.background: For the safety of cyclists, pedestrians and all road users It should be mandatory for all cyclists  (1) To pass a recognised cycling test (2) Carry valid Insurance (3) Hold a current bicycle MOT (4) Clearly display a bicycle number plate (5) Wear a cycle helmet and hi-vis clothing
attributes.additional_details: There are a number of cyclists who totally disregard the Highway Code. Motorists are easily identified by their registration plates, but cyclists are relatively anonymous. Cycling on footpaths is a danger to pedestrians. Undertaking when approaching left turns, cycling at night without lights and listening to music through headphones poses a danger to all road users as does ignoring traffic lights.  New laws will improve the quality of cycling, increase accountability and enhance road safety.

attributes.action: Create NHS teams for the atypical patients & stop them falling through the gaps
attributes.background: I have spent my life living with complex illnesses, and this coupled with also having a rare illness, I have found myself falling through the gaps in the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Because my situation and symptoms are 'atypical' I have spent the last few years being passed around in the system to different departments and teams, but never being taken on by their services as I do not meet the criteria or "fit in their box". This has been made worse by the funding crisis, as no one is prepared to take on the atypical cases.

I propose the creation of specialist multi-disciplinary teams to take on the atypical cases, so that no one also falls through the gaps in the system.

attributes.action: Put 1p on income tax and from proceeds fund NHS deficit £6b and social care £6b.
attributes.background: NHS has a deficit of c£6b pa. We also have inadequate social care provision (why hospitals are full of elderly not poorly people). I  believe the vast majority of people would be happy to pay an extra 1p in the £ to solve both problems. Funds to be ring fenced (so can't be spent on anything else).
attributes.additional_details: Seems so obvious but political parties are hamstrung in taking the initiative. It would require cross party agreement so that politics can be set to one side and common sense (what everyone knows but can't admit) be allowed to prevail. The important bit is to guarantee to taxpayers that the extra money can/will only be used for these two purposes (so controlled not by the government of the day but by some independent body).

attributes.action: Give the Public easy access to motorway CCTV cameras
attributes.background: The CCTV camera feeds provided by Traffic England can only be accessed via their official website, which is slow, cumbersome and not user-friendly. The Public should be allowed to create bookmarks/shortcuts to their favourite camera, or list of cameras, quickly and easily.
attributes.additional_details: Traffic Wales already provide this service, but England does not. During consultation, Highways England were unable to provide any legitimate reason for not allowing the Public to bookmark specific cameras or set up their own websites that show the live feeds in a more user-friendly format.

attributes.action: Make all incontinence products available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Many people across the UK, of all ages, suffer from bowel or bladder incontinence.
Across many areas, the NHS is lacking options available for people having to live with this condition.
We are offered adult nappies only,when there are other better options such as pull ups. Make those free on NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Bowel or bladder incontinence is a very difficult symptom to deal with. I believe many more adult continence products should be available from the NHS. Different people have different issues, and some products are suited to some, but not others. Give suffers the choice.
